txt.en: 'The pieces fall into place, and I begin to see the sad road that brought the shade of Tárandil to this place, and this state. Could he have turned away from this course, and prevented the evil he would cause? For I guess at the ending, and it is sorrowful. Still we must hear it.'
Vágari the Wanderer is by the waggon bearing the bones of Isildur northward.
Gandalf is by the waggon bearing the bones of Isildur northward.
Talk to Gandalf by the waggon in Laerlad
Vágari has manifested for a single purpose: he wishes to make his confession.
The shade of Isildur stares impassively at Vágari, and says nothing.
The shade of Isildur stares impassively at Tárandil, and says nothing.
'Let us hear what Vágari has to say.'
'My story begins long ago... so very long ago...'
Talk to Vágari and complete 'Instance: The Wanderer's Confession'
'Speak to Vágari, and we will judge him by the content of his confession.'
